isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 2000, 4000, 8000 - POWER DISTRIBUTION AND GROUND SYSTEM - OPERATION - 12 Volt Power Distribution (Ignition and Start)

svcproc.title: 12 Volt Power Distribution (Ignition and Start)
svcproc.para: Power is fed to key switch (24) on circuit 15 from junction block (J1). When the key is switched to the ignition position, power is supplied to the fuse panel power distribution center on circuits 13, 13A and 13F. Power is also supplied to circuit 13J Allison automatic transmission, to circuit 25 pyrometer, to circuit 39A automatic drain valve, and to circuit 17 push button start (if so equipped). (See individual circuits for continuation of circuitry.)

When the key switch is moved to the start position or the push button depressed, in addition to the key switch ignition position circuits listed above, power is also supplied on circuit 17 to the crank inhibit relay with International engines, or to the magnetic start switch for vehicles without International engines.
